geneVariantDescriptions.description: BRCA2 N136_L139del results in the deletion of four amino acids of the Brca2 protein from amino acids 136 to 139 (UniProt.org). N136_L139del has not been characterized in the scientific literature and therefore, its effect on Brca2 protein function is unknown; however, the corresponding cDNA change has been demonstrated to act as a reversion mutation in the context of a specific inactivating BRCA2 mutation, leading to restoration of the BRCA2 open reading frame and wild-type protein function, as demonstrated by interaction with Palb2 and Rad51 similar to wild-type Brca2 levels in culture and association with acquired resistance to platinum-based chemotherapy and a PARP inhibitor (PMID: 28765325).

references.title: Diverse BRCA1 and BRCA2 Reversion Mutations in Circulating Cell-Free DNA of Therapy-Resistant Breast or Ovarian Cancer.

evidence.efficacyEvidence: In a clinical case study, a patient with breast cancer harboring the germline mutation, BRCA2 N136Ifs*16, acquired two BRCA2 reversion mutations, V130_N136delinsD and N136_L139del, as detected in cell-free DNA post treatment with Paraplatin (carboplatin), and subsequently, did not respond to treatment with Talazoparib (BMN-673) (PMID: 28765325).

references.title: Diverse BRCA1 and BRCA2 Reversion Mutations in Circulating Cell-Free DNA of Therapy-Resistant Breast or Ovarian Cancer.
